definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
category/genus (taxonomy)/family members/dependents/to belong to/subordinate to/affiliated with/be born in the year of (one of the 12 animals)/to be/to prove to be/to constitute
to join together/to fix one's attention on/to concentrate on

sentences.english: The family that sold it to Mr. Gittes had turned it into a warren of apartments for various relatives.
sentences.chinese: 卖给吉茨的这家人把它变成了众多亲属居住的大杂院。

sentences.english: No friends or relatives are allowance to your employer's house or let them stay overnight.
sentences.chinese: 雇主严禁你带朋友或亲属到雇主屋企或让她们过夜。

sentences.english: But we usually mean by it the immediate, the nuclear family, with some extension.
sentences.chinese: 但通常都是指直系亲属，核心家庭，少量分支。

sentences.english: This text is mainly to compare the appellation of relatives in two different languages.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要对两种不同语言亲属称谓进行了对比。

sentences.english: Upon invitation from relatives of the dead, the celestial burial master goes to investigate how the dead died.
sentences.chinese: 收到死者亲属邀请后，天葬师会去了解死者的死因。

sentences.english: And Naomi said unto her, The man is near of kin unto us, one of our next kinsmen.
sentences.chinese: 拿俄米又说，那是我们本族的人，是一个至近的亲属。

sentences.english: They say that blood is thicker than water, that our relatives are more important to us than others.
sentences.chinese: 人们说血浓于水，即我们的亲属比别人对我们更重要。

sentences.english: Stay here for the night, and in the morning if he wants to redeem, good; let him redeem.
sentences.chinese: 你今夜在这里住宿，明早他若肯为你尽亲属的本分。

sentences.english: The estate was divided among the relatives.
sentences.chinese: 这笔遗产在亲属中分配。

sentences.english: Later Yao and Shun organized government and defined the relation of kin, since then, society started to break up.
sentences.chinese: 后来尧舜等组成政府，确定亲属关系，社会开始分裂。

sentences.english: Chinese language appellation system takes the relatives appellation terms as the base.
sentences.chinese: 汉语称谓以亲属称谓为基点。

sentences.english: Illegitimate child claim system is an important system of the family law.
sentences.chinese: 非婚生子女认领制度是亲属法上的一项重要制度。

sentences.english: Even lupus Kinfolk gather in tightly knit packs.
sentences.chinese: 即使狼亲属也被收入结构严密的组织。

sentences.english: After a while neighbors and kin just let her hoe.
sentences.chinese: 过了一阵子，邻居和亲属们也就不再拦着她了。

sentences.english: The family buried the dead relatives in the churchyard.
sentences.chinese: 家人把已故的亲属葬在教堂墓地。

sentences.english: Kinsfolk appellation is the kinsfolk system reflection in language.
sentences.chinese: 亲属称谓词是亲属制度在语言中的反映。

definition: a relative (i.e. family relation)/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to offer condolences (for the deceased)/to condole
